hero.title: Citizen Rights
hero.slogan: Your Data. Your Right. Our Responsibility.
hero.subtitle1: We inform individuals (data subjects) of their legally protected rights under the Somali Data Protection Act (Law No. 005/2023).
hero.subtitle2: The DPA is committed to ensuring all citizens understand and can exercise their rights regarding personal data.

rights.title: Right to Access
rights.desc: You have the right to obtain confirmation as to whether your personal data is being processed, and access to that data.

rights.title: Right to Rectification
rights.desc: If your personal data is inaccurate or incomplete, you have the right to request correction.

rights.title: Right to Erasure (Right to be Forgotten)
rights.desc: You may request deletion of your personal data under specific conditions (e.g., no longer necessary).

rights.title: Right to Object
rights.desc: You may object to processing of your personal data based on public interest or legitimate interest grounds.

rights.title: Right to Restrict Processing
rights.desc: You may request a temporary pause on the processing of your data, particularly while disputes over accuracy or legality are being resolved.

rights.title: Right to Data Portability
rights.desc: You can request to receive your data in a structured, commonly used, machine-readable format or request its transfer to another provider.

rights.title: Right not to be Subject to Automated Decision-Making
rights.desc: You are protected from decisions made solely based on automated processing (including profiling) without human involvement.

rights.title: Right to Lodge a Complaint
rights.desc: You may submit a complaint directly to the DPA if your data protection rights have been violated.
